page.title: 16Wivelsfield - Buildings
page.content:
{Wivelsfield Village Hall}was built in 1981,to commemorate the{Silver Jubilee of{Queen Elizabeth the Second.}It was built with a combination of money raised by the villagers and grants. It has become a focal point for the village and is used for functions of all kinds. It replaces the 'Reading Room' which was given to the village by a benefactor.The needs of the village outgrew the Reading Room and the lack of car parking became a problem.A small room in the new hall perpetuates the gift.
The hall is light and bright with a view over the village green. It contains a large and a small hall each with a kitchen and toilet facilities. The large hall contains a stage for plays and other productions.
